snippet: What makes a restaurant work? For one thing, personalization, a place with a working chef, not a cookie-cutter spinoff or a circus.
abstract: Mark Bittman How To Cook Everything column holds that what really impresses him in a restaurant is a not four-star rating or white tablecloths, but the ability to deliver on expectations consistently; says that the best restaurant is one that does something well and does not make him think he wasted his time leaving the house.
lead_paragraph: What makes a restaurant work? For one thing, personalization, a place with a working chef, not a cookie-cutter spinoff or a circus.

headline.seo: Sometimes Formica Is Better Than White Cloth — How to Cook Everything
headline.content_kicker: Fall Restaurant Preview | How to Cook Everything
